fields.description: For next Gen boards there is no option to have the status for the epic set seperately from the tasks on the board. for example for the epic's we would like it so it shows In Dev, Released etc but for the tasks we only want to do, in progress and done.
fields.summary: Status's on Epics

fields.description: As a user, I would like to have the ability to change the sidebar view to the pop-up window in the Backlog as happens in the Board.
fields.summary: Allow pop-up window when opening tickets in the Backlog

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When converting a Sub-task to issue (from a *Next-gen* project), the process will result in an error 500 in the end.

h3. Environment

Jira Cloud.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Perform a search that will return Sub-tasks of a Next-gen project;
* Hover over the line where one of those Sub-tasks is:
** Click on the ellipses button next to it -> *Convert to Issue*.

See the recording:  [^Convert to issue.mp4] 

h3. Expected Results

The conversion will occur normally.

h3. Actual Results

The process ends in an error 500.

h3. Notes

It seems like if you have the *Story* issue type added in the project, the process will still end in an error 500, but the conversion will occur.

That happened even after I've removed the *Story* issue type from the project.

h3. Workaround

Adding the *Story* issue type to the project may force the conversion to occur despite the error 500.

You might need to convert the Sub-task to Story first, and then change the issue type as desired.
fields.summary: Converting a Sub-task of a Next-gen project to issue results in error 500

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian status as of July 2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#b2d4ff|titleBGColor=#b2d4ff|bgColor=#eaf1fc}
Microsoft has not released any major updates for IE11 since 2015, and has [recently discouraged the use of IE11 as a default browser|https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/Windows-IT-Pro-Blog/The-perils-of-using-Internet-Explorer-as-your-default-browser/ba-p/331732].

To allow us to continue to take advantage of modern web standards to deliver improved functionality and the best possible user experience across all of our products, we have ended support for IE11 on *31 March 2020*.

End of support means we will not fix bugs that are specific to IE11, and will begin to introduce features that aren't compatible with this browser.

Find out more about this change from our [announcement|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Feedback-Forum-articles/Retiring-IE11-support-for-Atlassian-cloud-server-and-data-center/ba-p/1185312].

If you have questions or concerns about this change, please comment on this issue.
{panel}
fields.summary: Plans to end support for IE11

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-20269].  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
When you are on an active sprint page of a board, and you need to remove an item from that sprint, you can right-click on the card and see an option to "Remove from Sprint".   The problem here is that the user doesn't have any clear choice about where to place that issue, such as into the backlog, or select a specific upcoming sprint instead.

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be great if the user was prompted to select an option such as
* Backlog
* future planed sprint #1
* future planed sprint #2


h3. Why this is important
Gives scrum masters / sprint admins much more control over where issues end up.  Also it would help with the consistency in Jira Software. For example, when closing a sprint, you are prompted where to place those incomplete issues, a feature implemented by JSWCLOUD-6421

h3. Note
If no future sprints exist at the time this issue is to be removed from the board, then the board will place that issue in the backlog.
fields.summary: When removing issue from an active sprint on board, prompt user where to place that issue, such as backlog or future sprint

fields.description:
Hello,

We need the ability to archive unused projects so that we don't have a cluttered instance and to simplify search results and also improve search result performance. The suggested workaround to use permissions is not acceptable as we have a large mix of different project types and they all have different permission schemes so we would have to create several different ones. Also, this workaround does not help with search performance. 

This functionality was there in the past, so I'm not sure why it was removed, but we really need it back. 

Please help !
fields.summary: Please provide a way to archive projects in Jira Cloud instances

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Currently, you can use the *Parent link* field in the card layout so you can see a reference to the parent of a sub-task (that's useful when the parent in on a different column/status).

But, the field's information will be truncated:
 !Screen Shot 2019-09-23 at 14.13.12.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggestion

Either only display the issue key in that field so it will not be truncated, or have Jira display all the information of that field without the need of hovering over it.
fields.summary: Parent link field in the backlog view

fields.description:
According to this comment, [Jira has no plans|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-questions/Re-Re-Marking-issues-as-closed-or-won-t-do-in-the-next/qaq-p/932037/comment-id/298953#M298953] to add the ability to have multiple resolutions for an issue. 

This means, although we can mark an Issue as 'Done', there is no easy way to mark an issue as:
 * Closed - As Duplicate of another Issue.
 * Close - As "Won't Do".

Without this feature we are forced to either:
 * Delete the issue, (losing all the valuable digital assets that are related to it)
 * Mark this issue as Done (providing misinformation to the rest of team who may, naturally, come to the conclusion that all work in the issue is completed).

Please add a feature to allow multiple resolutions in Next Gen projects.

 

We cannot migrate to Next Gen until such a feature is added.


Update 27 Aug 2020 — [~blim2@atlassian.com] :

We don't expect to have _resolution_ in Next-gen this year. However, we are targeting to support multiple "Done" statuses in Next-gen by the end of the year.
fields.summary: Multiple resolutions - Resolve a Next Gen issue as something other than 'Done'

fields.description: As a user, I'd like to have calculated custom fields in Next-Gen projects.
fields.summary: Calculated Fields in Next-Gen projects

fields.description:
I have more components in my project, but I cannot add new, or edit existing components item, because the Components page is empty.

The same empty page arrives when clicking manage components button.
fields.summary: Components page is empty

fields.description:
The "Are you looking for Jira?" screen is very annoying.

I wouldn't be typing `jira.atlassian.com` if I were looking for anything other than Jira.
fields.summary: `jira.atlassian.com` should take you directly to Jira

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Unable to move issue from Backlog to Board section for Next-gen project

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Have a Next-gen project
# Enable "Backlog" feature (disable *Sprint* feature)
# Go to Backlog and attempt to move an issue from Backlog to Board

h3. Expected Results

Issue is moved to Board section.

h3. Actual Results

Issue isn't moved to Board section and hit the following error:
{noformat}
Something’s gone wrong. Refresh the page and try again.
{noformat}

h3. Notes

* It only affects Next-gen board with *Sprints* feature disabled.

h3. Workaround

Contact [Atlassian Support|https://support.atlassian.com/contact/]
fields.summary: Unable to move issue from Backlog to Board section for Next-gen project

fields.description:
h3.Summary

Due to similar names,  'Releases' can be confusing to customers who have DVCS integration. 

 !image-2019-09-23-15-48-25-620.png|thumbnail! 

The suggestion is to rename JIRA version release to 'Version Releases' instead of 'Releases'. Meanwhile the repository deployments can be renamed to 'Deployment' instead. This will reduce the risk of confusion for new users using the system.
fields.summary: Rename 'Releases' to 'Version Release' and the DVCS 'Releases' to 'Deployment'

can you give me more information about that

fields.description:
{color:#000000}Yes, now you know in  advance. I was able to see it last week now I cannot even access it. The field is labeled as the Actions (type, to access issue actions). Please see screenshot below{color}

Here is the issue that I was describing!

The square in the top left corner is not visible on the browser. This is were the ellipse, that I was referring to is located. It is not visible. On the second screenshot I was able to brings up the shortcut menu. The field is labeled as Actions (type, to access issue actions).

Please see the last screenshot below.
fields.summary: Not able to see the Actions (type, to access issue actions) menu button on the top righthand side

fields.description:
{panel:title= Implementation of New Features Policy|titleBGColor=#e0efff}
(i)
At the moment, we can't set an ETA for this feature to be released, since there's a number of factors that determine how our product team prioritizes new features.
 You can learn more by reading [Implementation of New Features Policy|https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/implementation-of-new-features-policy-201294576.html].
{panel}
h3. Problem Definition

"Update parent status" popup doesn't show up when all sub-tasks moved to "DONE" column if there's another column on the right because the popup shows up only if all sub-tasks moved to the far on the right of columns based on the current specification.

!スクリーンショット 2019-09-20 15.33.32.png|width=614,height=350!

!スクリーンショット 2019-09-20 15.41.00.png|width=616,height=351!
h3. Suggested Solution
 * Provide an option to show the popup when "Resolution" field changed.
 * Provide an option to choose the column which shows the popup.
 * Ability to transit parent issue along with sub-tasks (JRACLOUD-13012)

h3. Workflow
None. Consider adding yourself as a watcher to be kept informed as to the state of this feature request moving forward. With that way, if our development team updates the ticket, you'll be notified via email.
fields.summary: Provide an option to popup “Update parent status” other than column location

fields.description: At my work we are supposed to use Harvets in our Jira issues. I am using microsoft edge. when clicking "open harvetst time..." in an issue a pop up appears, there I have the option to select "Authorize...." and when I do a blank page in the pop up appears, And then nothing happens...
fields.summary: Jira Support for Harvest time tracking in microsoft edge

fields.description:
As a scrum master or developer, I would find it convenient to be able to key fields on a sub-task/child ticket from the parent view.

Ideally during scrum ceremonies, it would be efficient and convenient to be able to update the following fields from the parent view without having to navigate to a separate view:
 * Assignee
 * Estimate
fields.summary: Ability to update estimate and assignee on sub-task from parent

fields.description: Currently, field tabs are available only for classic projects. It would be great if we also have this option in next-gen to group similar fields in different tabs.
fields.summary: Ability to use Tab Fields in next-gen

fields.description:
When using Roadmaps in both Next-Gen and Classic Projects:

_I want to see a breakdown of the user stories in which an epic splits in the Roadmap view_

_So that I am able to see how the work on the epic goes and what is development pending ..._

 

_*Acceptance Criteria*_
 # _In the roadmap view, there will be an arrow to view or collapse all the US/Tasks from an epic._
 # _In the roadmap view, each US/Task should have its own dates (start date and due date) reflected in the roadmap (as a "Gantt project" would show)_
 # _The user can drag the US/Task to a different order_
 # _The US/Task should be ordered by start date as default order._
 # _A user can select a US/Task to edit or delete it_
fields.summary: Ability to see the breakdown of an epic in their tasks (with a + collapsible)

fields.description:
Overview:

Backlog page on a Jira cloud scrum project has the ability to filter a projects issues based on what Version and/or Epic the issue is associated.

Pain Point

My team has planned out 6 months of versions/Epics/ and issues.

This feature is critical to identify issues requiring attention in our backlog refinement meetings.  We take a lot of time scrolling through the left hand side menus to find the right filters to target a group of issues.

 

Suggestions:

1. When a version is selected from the left menu the epics menu is reduced to only epics within that version.

2. prove a search bar on the top of the Version and Epic menus so lists could be reduced when searching by key words.
fields.summary: Filter Fix versions and Epics in Backlog

fields.description: I am a huge fan of Epics, labels and relating tasks. 90% of my related tasks are managed in that way. But sometimes it makes the best sense to use a Parent Task with several sub-tasks. What does not necessarily follow is that all the sub-tasks will be accomplished in the same Sprint. It is frustrating to manage the Sprint at the parent Task level and carry all the sub-tasks from Sprint to sprint until they are all compete. Please allow them to be broken up.
fields.summary: Allow sub-tasks to be in different Sprints

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The Swimlane headers start to flicker and bug out when overlapping with another Swimlane header.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Apply a Swimlane on your Board (eg. Stories)
# Ever so gently scroll down the Board and overlap the Swimlane header with the next header

h3. Results

I start to flicker in and out.

 !2019-09-17_15-36-36.gif|width=400&height=200!
 
h3. Notes

Reproducible on Chrome and Firefox.

h3. Workaround
No workaround, just scroll back and forth.
fields.summary: Swimlane header flickering when overlapping with other headers

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Currently, for Jira Software you have a predefined set of possible [Swimlanes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/configuring-swimlanes-764478010.html] you can have on your Board.

This includes *Epics* and *Stories* which are both parents like fields with child issues. However, the *Parent Link* field which is only active by having Portfolio enabled, isn't part of this list.

For some users, the Epic or Story level isn't sufficient and custom levels higher above are used thanks to Portfolio's hierarchy configuration. Because the *Parent Link* isn't taking into account, *Swimlanes* can't be grouped on this level unless you make it query base which can be very manual work.

h3. Proposed solution

Include the *Parent Link* to the list of possible *Swimlanes* to you Jira Board so that users working with custom issue levels can benefit from the grouped view and have a clear overview.

 !KANBAN_-_Agile_Board_-_JIRA.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Swimlane for Parent Link field

fields.description:
When restaurants request a special it comes into this google spreadsheet: [https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1YNXJvnajNeSgrrS3e4Wdr1dMDW9S7ijUPqHIbLFNJ0A/edit#gid=889223664]

 

It would be great if this was possible to make country specific in terms of monitoring this sheet.
fields.summary: Make Specials Country Specific

fields.description:
In Jira classic projects, make it possible to show the "status" of issues when viewing issues in the "Backlog" view, e.g. lozenge, colored story points, or shorthand letters for statuses. 

It would be useful to know the status of issues (e.g. already In Progress) when sprints are closed and issues are carried over to the next sprint.

Mirrors https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-17469 for Jira next-gen.
fields.summary: Show/Indicate Status of Issues in Backlog

fields.description: 开发要快一些！
fields.summary: 开发运营一体化平台开发

fields.description: Allow Issue Schema to be applied to Next Gen projects
fields.summary: Apply Issue Schema to Next Gen

fields.description: Create a checklist field type on issues cards that allows users to create checklists on the card. At times this is more useful than creating a child card.
fields.summary: Checklist Field Type

fields.description:
As a Board Administrator, I'd like to change the avatar displayed on a Board from the Assignee user to the Reporter. 

Currently, it always displays the Assignee user on the Card.
fields.summary: Ability to change the avatar from a Card on a Board

fields.description:
Issue Summary

Agile Wallboard Gadget added to a dashboard configured from a Kanban board has a layout issue. If the Kanban board has swimlanes based on queries, the name of first swimlane will not appear on the wallboard gadget.

Environment - Jira cloud

 Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Kanban board with multiple swimlanes
 # Create a dashboard and add wallboard gadget with the kanban board attached. The name of swimlane will not show up.

Expected - Name of swimlane should show up
 Actual - Shown in the attached screenshots, the name is chopped off.

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
h3.
fields.summary: Swimlane name not showing up in Agile Wallboard Gadget

fields.description: Currently, there is no functionality to share the  Single Level Group Report reports among other users. It will be great if the user can configure the report and then share across the user.
fields.summary: Ability to share Single Level Group Report

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Search Syntax Help-Link in Board Quick Filters doesn't work
h3. Environment

Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Go to the board quick filter > write any query and click in Syntax Help
h3. Expected Results

It will open the syntax help page: [https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/search-syntax-for-text-fields-764478343.html].
h3. Actual Results

Nothing happens
 !Screen Shot 2019-08-01 at 16.10.20.png|thumbnail! 
  
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Search Syntax Help Link in Board Quick Filters doesn't work

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Adding a JQL with more than 255 characters in *Board settings* > *Card colors* does not allow to save (Add) the setting and throws a 500 error in browser DevTools panel.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to *Board settings* > *Card colors*
 # Write a JQL with more than 255 characters
 # Click on *Add*

h3. Expected Results

Card colors JQL is saved
h3. Actual Results
Card colors JQL is not saved, no error appears in UI

h3. Workaround
Save the JQL as a filter and use filter's ID in Card color JQL. e.g filter = <filter-id>
fields.summary: Card colors JQL is limited to 255 characters

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When searching for issues in a sprint on a team-managed (formerly next-gen) project, all sub-task that inherited the sprint from the parent would not be shown

h3. Environment
team-managed (formerly next-gen)


h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a team-managed (formerly next-gen) project
 # Create an issue
 # Create a subtask on the issue
 # Create a sprint, i.e Sprint 1
 # Move the issue to the sprint.
 # Run this JQL: {code}Sprint = "Sprint 1"
{code}

h3. Expected Results
The parent and child issue are displayed on the list

h3. Actual Results
No sub task is showing

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Unable to search for sub tasks in a sprint on a team-managed (formerly next-gen) project

fields.description:
As a Scrum Master (or) Product Owner

I would like to be able to customize the card details that display in the board view 

So that I can identify custom fields that I want to see in card details board view.

 

 

Example:

I have created a custom field for "platform". I want to be able to see this field from the board view without having to click into a card.
fields.summary: Ability to Customize Card Details on Board View

fields.description:
h3. Summary

A user who is on a role without the manage Sprint permission of a next-gen project gets "you're logged out" error when trying to complete the sprint for the project.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a "Limited" access next-gen project
 # Try to complete a sprint from a user who only has a "Viewer" role for the project

h3. Expected Results
The "Complete Sprint" button should be hidden or greyed out.

h3. Actual Results

Jira Cloud throws a "You're logged out" error to the user.

  !Screen Shot 2019-09-11 at 5.01.29 PM.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Add the user as a "Member" or "Administrator" to the project to enable them to complete the sprint.
fields.summary: Completing sprint for next-gen project gives "You're logged out" error when user is on viewer role of the project

fields.description:
Fisheye "Create review for all commits" link is missing on the commit tab in the new issue view.
h3. Environment
 * Jira Software Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Connect Jira and Fisheye via Application Link
 # Create a Commit and link it to Jira using the Issue Key
 # Click on the Commit link on the development panel to open the commit tab

h3. Expected Results

The "Create review for all commits" link is visible in the Commit tab
h3. Actual Results

The "Create review for all commits" link is missing
h3. Workaround

Click the "*See the old view*" option above on the right side, to change the display to the old view. You can also *disable the Lab option* to use only the old issue view by doing the following:
 # Click on your Avatar on the Left Sidebar > Personal Settings
 # Scroll down to Jira Labs
 # Toggle the button off
fields.summary: Create review links are missing on the commit tab in the new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In a next-gen project, Create a task and subtask and make them belong to the same sprint
# In the Jira issue search screen, perform search by the following:
{code}
project = <project key> AND Sprint = <sprint id>
{code}

h3. Expected Results
The task and the subtask shows up in the search result

h3. Actual Results
Only the task shows up in the search result 

h3. Workaround
There are no workarounds at the moment

h3. Note
This is affecting the following APIs as well
* {{/rest/api/2/search}} (passing "Sprint=<id>" as argument)
* {{/rest/agile/1.0/sprint/}}
fields.summary: Unable to search for subtasks when filtered by sprint

fields.description:
It would be really helpful to quickly see the sub-tasks under a given issue when planning in the backlog page. 

h3. Suggestion  

Add the ability to show the sub-tasks under a given Story without opening the issue detail view.
fields.summary: Ability to expand Stories to see sub-tasks in the Backlog page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If a user was renamed and they are an administrator of a board, then hovering the user will display "User does not exist" message - On a classic project
h3. Environment

Jira Software Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Rename a user (no longer available)
 # Go to board settings on a classic project
 # Change the board administrator to user
 # Hover the user name

h3. Expected Results

Jira should try loading the user information with the new user name
h3. Actual Results

Jira try loading the user information with  the old user name
h3. Workaround

N/A
fields.summary: User does not exist is displayed on board while hovering a user

fields.description: We would like to be able to group our tasks on a next gen project into swimlanes by priority. We do that all the time on old gen boards in order to float high priority tasks to the top without having to reorder them. At the moment (Sept 2019) we can only group by assignee and subtask. I think Epic _might_ also be possible, though we don't have it turned on.
fields.summary: Next gen board swimlanes by priority

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently the progress bar displayed in parent issue is calculated evenly based on the number of subtasks and does not represent the story point estimation of each sub tasks

h3. Suggested Solution
Progress bar should be calculated based on story pint estimation, for example If I have a summary task with two subtasks, one which has story points 2 and the other one 4 than display should be 33% against 67% based on the story points estimates.
Same thing applies for the time tracking and remaining hours.

h3. Workaround
No workaround available currently.
fields.summary: Next-Gen: Calculating subtask progress bar based on story point estimation

fields.description: Currently, it is unable to move the parent issue when the board is grouped by subtask. In the Classic project, we can move subtasks and parent issues in the same setting. It would be great if we have this feature in next-gen projects too.
fields.summary: Ability to move parent issues when grouped by subtask in next-gen projects

fields.description: Would be nice if Next-Gen sprints could have a simplified date format, or even an option for it on the Backlog view. Currently it is {{D/Mon/YY HH:MM PM}}, which seems really unnecessary for a supposedly simplified format. I use dates when planning future sprints (for milestones, deadlines, etc), and usually I just resort to putting MM/DD notes in the Sprint description because it's easier to glance at.
fields.summary: Simplify Sprint date format

fields.description: In classic, you can right click an issue or story to access the sub-menu, but in next-gen the only option is to use the "..." menu to the right. Would like to be able to right click for menu access.
fields.summary: Right click for sub-menu

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian status as of August 2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#b2d4ff|titleBGColor=#b2d4ff|bgColor=#eaf1fc}
Hello all,

Thank you for watching, voting, and commenting on this issue.

Now, you should be able to drag-and-drop single or multiple issues onto an epic in the epic panel. To learn more and/or provide feedback about the epic panel, please [read our community post here|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Next-gen-articles/Improved-Backlog-planning-in-next-gen-with-the-epic-panel/ba-p/1387675].

We are closing this ticket as resolved. If you feel this issue hasn’t been fully addressed, kindly tell us more about your use case.

Thank you,
 Emily Chan
 Product Manager, Atlassian. 
{panel}
 

My team recently moved to next gen from classic, and previously when decomposing issues and stories into multiple parts, I would create all the stories quickly and then use the drag and drop functionality to sort them into epics. Would love to see this again, or an alternative way to designate common fields without having to bulk-update or open each item individually to edit. The "Add parent" in the sub-menu is 4-5 clicks to complete what used to be only one.
fields.summary: Drag and drop ability for epics

fields.description: Having the possibility to set the month span on the quarters of the roadmap feature, would help companies to match their fiscal year.  Also, this would beneficial to organize their work better.
fields.summary: Set the month span on the quarters of the roadmap feature

fields.description: Since there's no way to add a swimlane (WAT?), can we get the ability to group by priority?  Better yet, let us customize what we can group by.  We can't see what needs to be expedited because there's no way to easily surface those issues without a whole lot of clicking.
fields.summary: Group by priority (or let us customize)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When calling the REST API endpoints starting with {{/rest/agile/1.0/board/ID/sprint}} the value set for the parameter maxResults is not taken into account if it is bigger than '50' (it always return 50). The parameter startAt works fine instead.


h3. Environment
Jira cloud

(Optional - If Applicable)
 *
 *
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Call any {{agile/1.0/board}} endpoint passing a value for maxResults that is lower than 50
# See that this works fine. E.g. https://NAME.atlassian.net/rest/agile/1.0/board/ID/sprint?startAt=20&maxResults=20 {noformat}
{
  "maxResults": 20,
  "startAt": 20,
  "isLast": false,
  "values": [ .......
{noformat}
# Call the same endpoint passing a value for maxResults that is bigger than 50. E.g.
#- https://NAME.atlassian.net/rest/agile/1.0/board/1/sprint?startAt=20&maxResults=70 


h3. Expected Results
The maxResults value in the REST response is correctly set to the desired value


h3. Actual Results

maxResult is always set to 50
{noformat}
  "maxResults": 50,
  "startAt": 20,
  "isLast": true,
  "values": [.....
{noformat}
 
h3. Notes

The same issue reproduces calling:
- /rest/agile/1.0/board
- /rest/agile/1.0/board/ID/project
- /rest/agile/1.0/board/ID/epic
- /rest/agile/1.0/board/ID/sprint

(Optional - If Necessary)
h3. Workaround

Use the startAt parameter to get all the results
fields.summary: maxResults values bigger than 50 are not taken into account when calling /rest/agile/1.0/board REST API endpoint

fields.description: As a user of the Cumulative flow diagram report, I would like to generate the CFD report based on story points, besides issue counts.
fields.summary: As a user of the Cumulative flow diagram report, I would like to generate the CFD report based on story points, besides issue counts.

fields.description:
When using the Presentation mode by hitting the "z" key, the Complete sprint button is hidden.
I would like to propose that the button not be hidden as it does not save sufficient space to be worth removing, and can inhibit the usability of the mode.
fields.summary: Show Complete Sprint button when in High contrast Presentation mode.

fields.description:
h3. Summary:

When looking to a pull request from the development section within a Jira issue, data is inconsistent regarding the reviewer field.

h3. Steps to reproduce:
 # refer a Jira issue when creating a *Pull request* on GitHub. For example: _PROJ-2 #comment new pull request_.
 # Set a 'reviewer' to that Pull request on GitHub side (Navigate to *Pull requests* > click on the *reviewer* cog icon in the right column).
 # Go to that *PROJ-2* issue view > navigate to the *development* section at the right side and click on *pull request*.
 # You should not see the *reviewer* field filled.

h3. Expected Results
The reviewer from GitHub is listed on Jira.

h3. Actual Results
Jira is not updating the reviewer.

 !_SCRUM-212__Testing_Story_number_CSV_1191_-_JIRA.png|thumbnail! 
 !·_Pull_Request__16.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Jira is not syncing reviewer from GitHub

fields.description:
Hello, Next Gen projects hit 99% of our requirements but it is absolutely critical for us to be able to add Stories to an Epic across next gen projects.

Example:

Next Gen Project A includes Epic ABC123 

Next Gen Project B includes Story linked to Epic ABC123

The reason we need this is because we have shared resources across projects that need to all use the same epic. We plan our work quarterly with Epics, and members across projects contribute to the epics. 

Please please enable this functionality so our company of 600+ can utilize Next Gen. Until then we are stuck with Classic.

Thank you!
fields.summary: Link Stories to Epics across Next Gen projects

fields.description: I would love to be able to change the project's lead in next-gen projects. Somehow it doesn't make sense that you see the creator of the project as the project lead while not being able to change it.
fields.summary: Being able to change a project lead

fields.description:
As a product owner and manager, i would like to have see the context menu for each cards in the Next gen project Board and customize the context menu as well.

As of now i am able to see only "Add Flag" and "Add Label" and no provision to include other options.

For example: I would like to have another option as Change Assignee where i can assign or change an assignee.
fields.summary: Enabling context menu and customization for Cards of the same

fields.description:
When having similar projects, sometimes we want to set the same roadmap with different starting dates.
It would be great if there were any functions to reuse the same roadmap in several projects. Possible candidates would be:
* project templates that include actual epics
* ability to export/import roadmap data
fields.summary: Ability to reuse the roadmap

fields.description:
This has been annoying me for long.
 E.g. I see a error in description, click precisely on the spot, hoping to type straightaway, but ending up the caret flashing at *wrong place*, all thank to the formatting bar appearance.

!image-2019-09-04-12-30-12-409.png!

 

Not sure if it is too hard.
But definitely suggest a better solution: either let the caret land correctly, or show the formatting bar at the bottom(?)
fields.summary: Text field entering edit mode losing clicked position by formatting bar

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The Epic quick filter option in backlog and boards are not being displayed on Next-Gen projects.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Next-Gen project and create an Epic
# Access the Backlog

h3. Expected Results
It should have the option to filter by Epics on the side of the search box.

h3. Actual Results
It doesn't show the option - an example can be checked on this video: https://cl.ly/fec14c4bcc28


h3. Workaround
There isn't any at the moment.
fields.summary: Next-Gen Projects are not Displaying the Epic Quick Filter Option

fields.description:
As a user, I'd like to be able to decrease the story point estimate as it is possible with time estimation to report for what has been done inside a sprint based on the Story Estimation in cases that the issue was carried over to the next sprint.
With that, we can have more accurate data of what has been accomplished inside one sprint and what has been carried over to the new sprint for teams that don't use time tracking.
fields.summary: As a user, I'd like to be able to decrease the story point estimate as it is possible with time estimation

fields.description:
With only two field in create Jira issue dialog box in slack , the mandatory fields in issue screen in Jira starts throwing error and prevents the creation of issue.

We would require two things :

1. Allow mandatory fields to be displayed in create Jira issue dialog box in slack.
2. Allow some configuration to choose which fields to be displayed in the create jira issue dialog box in Slack.
fields.summary: Ability to configure fields to be displayed in the create jira issue dialog box in Slack and Allow mandatory fields to be displayed in create Jira issue dialog box in slack.

fields.description: This function is available on Classic, but could we please have the "Unassigned" quick filter added to Next Gen.
fields.summary: Add "unassinged" to filter on Jira Next Gen backlog view and board

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In a classic software project, open one issue(issue A) that belongs to a board
# Open another issue(issue B) that belongs to the same board
# Click the search icon in the sidebar and select issue A from "RECENT ISSUES"

h3. Expected Results
Issue A gets loaded

h3. Actual Results
Issue A gets loaded, however the title of the page remains as issue B 

h3. Workaround
There are no workarounds for this moment.
fields.summary: When navigating to an issue that belongs to the same board from quick search, the page title does not get refreshed

fields.description:
Allow more filtering options (Like JQL) to use the Cumulative Flow Diagram in Next-gen projects, like:
 * Select a specific Sprint to be displayed in the Report
 * Choose issue types to be displayed in the Report
 * Choose Priority and labels to be displayed in the Report
fields.summary: Allow more filtering options in the Cumulative Flow Diagram for Next-gen Projects
Modify migration from Jira Cloud to Server documentation

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

After renaming an issue without refreshing the page, Jira still shows the old name for seconds when we select the ticket in the backlog
h3. Environment

* Next-gen backlog

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# On the backlog, let the sidebar opened and change the summary of an issue.
# Click on another issue and then click back to the updated issue.

h3. Expected Results

It shows the new summary.

h3. Actual Results

It shows the old summary and then the new one.

h3. Notes

Even if it's seconds, it may be confusing if many people are working on the same backlog.

h3. Workaround

Refresh the page.
fields.summary: After renaming an issue, Jira still shows the old name for seconds when we select the ticket in the backlog

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

For some users, issue view doesn't display user avatar but initials instead due to an earlier incident , detailed at [Some user avatars are missing for JSW Cloud users|https://jira-software.status.atlassian.com/incidents/jnygk8kr6f1t].

Other views related to board and backlog should be working fine. 
  
h3. Workaround

As a temporary workaround , users can overcome this bug by setting their avatar as "publicly visible". Do consider sensitivity of users while proceeding with this workaround . Changes can be made by users directly by accessing the URL below
 * [https://id.atlassian.com/manage-profile/profile-and-visibility]
fields.summary: Non public avatars are not always visible on Issue view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In the documentation [Manage epics on the roadmap|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/manage-epics-on-the-roadmap-976172306.html] it's described that it's possible to create and see dependencies between Epics in the Roadmap, but users are bot being able to see this.

h3. Environment

Jira Software cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a next-gen project in a Jira Software cloud site
# Add Epics and Stories to the project
# Enable the Roadmap feature using the * Project settings > Features* option
# Make sure that [issue linking|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/configuring-issue-linking-818578890.html] is enabled in the Jira cloud site
# Hover over an epic to reveal dots on either side of an epic. 
# Drag one of the dots to the epic you want to link it to. 

h3. Expected Results

The link/dependency between the Epics is created

h3. Actual Results

The dots are not visible and it isn't possible to create links between Epics

 !Screen Shot 2019-08-29 at 7.30.21 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes

Users cannot either see the links in the Roadmap view

h3. Workaround

 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: It's not possible to create dependency links between epics in Roadmap

fields.description:
JIRA presently supports three different types of projects:
 * Service Desk
 * Software
 * Business

I'd suggest that the "Software" project type be renamed "Development" as projects there are not necessarily about software.  My company uses JIRA to track hardware and software development projects, and in both cases we do so with releases, sprints, milestones, and burndown.   The methodology is the same, but the work product is different.

$.02
fields.summary: Rename JIRA "Software" Projects to "Development" Projects

fields.description:
Currently, users will only need to have project administration role on the projects to be able to start sprint. It does not need other condition.

However, there are cases that user would only want certain status to be achieved before a sprint can be started. 

For example refer to the screenshot below:
!startsprint.png!

So as a recommendation, to imply some condition before the sprint can be started.
fields.summary: Fulfill Certain Condition before Sprint can be Started

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

At this moment when you open the panel of the road map, there's no way to expand it or click/drag the panel that opens on the right side.


h3. Suggested Solution

It would be great if the user could click/drag the panel that opens to be able to work with details and especially sub-tasks easier.


h3. Why this is important

When viewing the details of an Epic, in a NexGen Kanban road map view, sometimes the user is not able to see the complete title of a subtask as the window is too small and titles get cut off.
fields.summary: ability to expand the panel of the road

fields.description: Allow users to configure which issue types are included in Cumulative Flow Diagram. Currently, the report treats Epics and Tasks the same, which doesn't provide an accurate representation of work.
fields.summary: Refine issue types included in Cumulative Flow Diagram (Next-Gen)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If you try to create the board through the board search menu, it didn't allow you to set the name of it and therefore you can't create the board. The field gets greyed out and it's not edible. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Click search magnifying glass;
# Click on "Boards" button at the bottom (search boards);
# Click on Create Board button (upper right);
# Select any option for the board (Kanban Board / Existing Project)
# In the last window (New project with board), Cannot enter text into Board Name;

h3. Expected Results

The field for the board name should be available to be entered text

h3. Actual Results

The field is greyed out and text can't be entered

h3. Notes

h3. Workaround

h4. Workaround 1
A workaround will be to create the board through a project menu or within another board, using the create board button.

h4. Workaround 2
Another workaround is to press the space button and the focus will go back to the board name fields, allowing you to add a board name.
fields.summary: Can't add name to the board during the creation

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, issues are displayed based on their rank and they can be manually sorted in the board's view, but there is no way to sort issues based on specific criteria, for example, last update or creation date

h3. Suggested Solution

As a next-gen user, I want a way to sort issues in the board's view, like a quick filter or similar feature which allows sorting the issues based on their last update, create date, etc.
fields.summary: As a Jira Software user, I want next-gen boards to provide a way to sort issues in columns

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If you have Time Estimation enabled, Burndown does not reduce the time remaining when logging hours in a transition screen if the workflow has a post-function to clear the time remaining after the transition. It logs the information that the issue had work logged but does not reduce from the total of time remaining. Therefore, the post-function clears the time remaining like if no time was logged.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a post-function that will clear the Time Remaining during a transition from status A to status B
# Add a screen to log hours during the transition from status A to status B
# Estimate the issue (I.e:. Time Remaining 30min)
# Transition an issue from status A to status B, the transition screen will open to log hours, add 5min and save
# The post-function will clear the time remaining
# Check the Burndown chart, it displays that time was logged (5m was logged, but time reduced does not change, it shows that time remaining was reduced from 30m to 30m)
# The post-function clears the time remaining and logs against the burndown chart (Time remaining changed from 30m to 0)

h3. Expected Results
The Burndown should resolve the transition screen first and logs accordingly the time logged and then resolve the post-function

h3. Actual Results
The Burndown does not resolve the transition screen, just log that time was changed but does not change in fact.

h3. Workaround
Log time before doing the transition and skip the transition screen to avoid this bug.
fields.summary: Burndown chart does not reduce time remaining when logging hours in a transition screen if the workflow has a post-function to clear the time remaining after the transition

fields.description:
Currently the sprint goal is showed below the sprint name, so it need a new line and takes many space from the board. 

My suggestion should be to store the sprint goal next to the sprint name, so we can get extra space for the tasks! 

!image-2019-08-27-13-39-32-011.png!
fields.summary: Sprint goal visibility next to the Sprint name

fields.description: Implementation of military time within the sprint creation form.
fields.summary: Implementation of military time within the sprint creation form.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When scrolling down in a scrum board with swimlanes, the header of a swimlane will have a rendering problem at some point when it overlays another swimlane's header.

h3. Environment

Jira Cloud.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Configure the scrumboard to use swimlanes (e.g. Stories);
* Scroll down the board so a swimlane's header will meat another swimlane.

See the recording:  [^Swimlane header.mp4] 

h3. Expected Results

The transition from a swimlane to another one should be smooth.

h3. Actual Results

The rendering of a header will impact in another one.

h3. Workaround

None at the moment.
fields.summary: Swimlane header breaks when it overlays another swimlane's header

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When using project settings in next gen JSW projects when I don't have a software license, the Features page is available but fails to load.

h3. Environment

 * JSW next-gen project
 * No Software license

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set up an instance with a software license and a service desk license
# Create a JSW next-gen project
# Remove your software license (but keep the service desk license)
# Open project settings in your jsw next-gen project
# Go to the Features page

h3. Expected Results
Either the Features link should not show up in project settings, or the features page should work.

h3. Actual Results
The Features link shows up, but clicking on it results in a broken page (it has a loading skeleton which displays forever).

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Cancelling your software license causes the next-gen Features page tofail to load

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If you create a field called "Rank" on next-gen, without a warning, it disables Ranking across the instance.

 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a classic project, make sure rank works
 # Create a next-gen project, create a rank field on any available issue type

h3. Expected Results

New field in next-gen called "Rank" doesn't affect global ranking
h3. Actual Results

Rank is disabled across the instance

 
h3. Workaround

Remove the new "Rank" field in next-gen. Make sure it is removed not just not part of the issue type.
fields.summary: Creating Rank field on  next-gen project affects Rank field across all projects

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Next-gen boards are showing the errors below:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Environment
Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open a Next-gen board

h3. Expected Results
No error is listed.

h3. Actual Results
Boards are loading but with errors. 

h3. Notes
This is not impacting all sites.

h3. Workaround
There is no workaround to suppress the pop-up
fields.summary: Plan view data failed to load

fields.description:
We currently have multiple child issues under each Epic. Team members log their work in the issue, but that data doesn't make it to the Epic level. Below is a current state vs. desired state example:

*Current State:*

Epic 001 New Widget, Time Logged: {color:#FF0000}+0 hrs+{color}
 * Child Issue 001, Time Logged: 10 hrs
 * Child Issue 002, Time Logged: 50 hrs
 * Child Issue 003, Time Logged: 40 hrs 

 

*Desired State:*

Epic 001 New Widget, Time Logged: {color:#00875a}+100 hrs+{color}
 * Child Issue 001, Time Logged: 10 hrs
 * Child Issue 002, Time Logged: 50 hrs
 * Child Issue 003, Time Logged: 40 hrs 

 

It would help to know how much time the team spent on the Epic for future planning. At the moment we have to manually add up the time logged on each issue and then type it into the Epic. This is inefficient and cumbersome as the amount of projects and epics continue to grow.
fields.summary: Populate Epic Work Log with Time Logged in Child Issues

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Based on the documentation [Velocity Chart|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/velocity-chart-777002731.html],:
{quote}*Other things to note about the Velocity Chart:*
It's based on your board's column mapping. An issue is considered to be 'To Do' when it is in a status that has been mapped to the left-most column of your board. Similarly, an issue is considered to be 'Done' when it is in a status that has been mapped to the right-most column of your board.{quote}

That means that it should consider on the report only those issues whose status is mapped in any of the active columns. On the other hand, issues which status aren't mapped should not be considered as we don't know if it should be worked or not.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Scrum board and add issues
# Create a sprint
# Estimate the issues
# Add issues to the sprint
# Make sure that at least one of the issues is in the status that is not going to be mapped
# Edit the status mapping columns and remove one of the statuses
# Start the sprint
# Check the Velocity Chart report;

I recorded a video reproducing the problem: https://cl.ly/396d6e01a1f4

h3. Expected Results
The commitment column should have a value of 20.

h3. Actual Results
The commitment column has a value of 25. This report is considering all issues that were in the sprint at the moment of its start. It's not taking into account the status mapping on the board columns. 

h3. Workaround
 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Velocity Chart is considering into the report issues on unmapped statuses

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When using the *Create Branch* feature from the *Development panel*, Jira redirects to Bitbucket and copies the issue's summary as is to the Branch name.

The problem is that some characters, such as *double quotes* and *slashes*, have specific meaning or need to be escaped when running Git commands, which is not ideal.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In Jira, create an issue with a summary that contains special characters (i.e. slashes, double quotes)
 # Click the *Create Branch* button
*  !Screen Shot 2019-08-21 at 5.05.07 PM.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Expected Results
Jira should either process these characters and send a payload that contained a name did not require any additional processing or Bitbucket should automatically convert these characters to something supported 

h3. Actual Results
Jira passes the payload using the exact summary used by the issue, which eventually may cause problems when running Git commands.
* *{{TPK-115-this-summary-has-"quotes"-and-a/slash}}*


h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available. At this point, the only way to avoid this is by not using special characters in the summary or manually updating the branch name
fields.summary: Better Handling of Special Characters when using Create Branch feature

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Team-managed (formerly next-gen) projects - Changing the issue type triggers the bulk edit action.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a team-managed (formerly next-gen) project.
 # Create two issue types with the same fields.
 # Create a new issue.
 # Try to change the new issue's issue type.

h3. Expected Results

You can easily switch between two different issue types.
h3. Actual Results

The bulk edit action is being triggered.
h3. Notes

On company-managed (formerly classic) projects, we can switch between issues types if those issue types are part of the same workflow.
 On team-managed (formerly next-gen) projects, we were able to switch between issue types since all issue types are connected to the same "workflow".
h3. Workaround

Perform the bulk edit action.
h3. Root cause:

The bulk move has been triggered due to the mismatch in the backend in terms of the number of required fields between the source and designated issue types. The mismatch happens due to a bug we had in the past which accidentally un-require a field which by default should be required.
fields.summary: Team-managed (formerly next-gen) projects - Changing the issue type triggers the bulk edit action.

fields.description:
While mentioning a user in the old issue view, it will display both user's display name and the account id before the comment is added.
 !commt.png|thumbnail! 
Ideally, the account ID should be excluded while mentioning the user.
fields.summary: User's account ID shouldn't be display while mentioning the user in comment/description section in old issue view

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When creating a branch from Jira, if the issue summary begins with a square bracket, the first bracket '[' is removed from the branch name

h3. Environment
(Optional - If Applicable)
* Jira Cloud
* Bitbucket Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Jira issue with the square bracket in the summary (e.g. [Test Issue] Sample ticket)
# Click on the Create Branch link

h3. Expected Results
* The branch name is ABC-123-[test-issue]-sample-ticket

h3. Actual Results
* The branch name is ABC-123-test-issue]-sample-ticket


h3. Workaround
* Edit the branch name manually
* Use another bracket style (e.g. () or {})
fields.summary: Initial square bracket is removed from branch name created from within Jira

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
* For the migration between instances, we can choose whether to include to avatars and attachments
* If we didn't include the avatars during/after the migration, we can't upload a new custom project avatar

h3. Environment
 * Migration between Jira Cloud
* Next-gen projects

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a project with next-gen template
# Change the project avatar/icon with a custom image
# Create a site backup *without Include additional files*
# Import the backup file into a new Jira site
# Once the import is done, access the project settings of the next-gen project

h3. Expected Results
* Users can upload a new icon like classic projects even though the current icon is broken. Example:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!  !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
* "Change icon" button is grayed out and we couldn't revert to the system icons or upload a new one
 !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
* Users can revert to the system icons or upload a new icon on Classic projects even though the current project icon is broken
* Admins can revert to the system icons or upload a new icon for site logo/favicon even though the current logo/favicon is broken

h3. Workaround
* Upload the avatars so the project icons are working. Then, the "Change icon" button will be working.
fields.summary: After a migration, unable to change Project Avatar for Next-Gen projects

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
This issue [BIT-9|https://anandi1.atlassian.net/browse/BIT-9?oldIssueView=true] doesn't show a branch creation activity before the pull request creation. When the pull request was merged, it instead shows a branch creation activity.
 !Screenshot 2019-08-19 at 6.07.33 PM.png|thumbnail! 
This branch creation caused the issue to move from *Peer Review* back to *In Progress*. As the issue was in *In Progress* when the pull request was merged, the transition from *Peer Review* to *Developer Testing* didn't happen. The time of the merge coincides with the *branch creation activity* showing up in history. So the suspicion is that the merge activity actually got recorded as a branch creation one and hence the issue was transitioned from *Peer Review* back to *In Progress* instead of *Peer Review* to *Developer Testing*.
h3. Steps to reproduce
* Configure workflow like below:
** When a pull request is created, the issue transitions from *In Progress* to *Peer Review*.
** When a branch is created, the issue transitions from *Peer Review* to *In Progress*.
** When pull request is merged, the issue transitions from *Peer Review* to *Developer Testing*.
* Create an issue and already change the status to *In Progress* before creating a branch.
* Create a branch followed by creating a pull request.
* Merge the pull request. Ensure to check *Close Source Branch* while merging.

h3. Expected behaviour:
* The merge activity should appear and the issue should transition from *Peer Review* to *Developer Testing*.

h3. Actual Behaviour:
* The issue should show only the pull request and NOT the branch after this in the *Development Panel*.
* The issue history shows a branch creation activity when the pull request was merged AND the status of the issue is therefore *In Progress* and NOT *Developer Testing*

(Optional - If Necessary)
h3. Workaround

Don't transition the issue to *In Progress* manually. Let the workflow trigger do it, when the branch is created.
fields.summary: Merge activity in bit bucket is recorded as a branch creation activity

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Click on Board settings and navigate to Card colors tab.
!image-2019-08-19-16-27-12-969.png!

h3. Expected Results

I expect to be taken to an article with explanations about how to use card colours. [https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/customizing-cards-764478020.html]
h3. Actual Results

I am taken to [https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRASOFTWARECLOUD/Customising+Cards].
h3. Notes

(Optional - If Necessary)
h3. Workaround

In the search bar, type "Customising Cards" and navigate to a page called "Customizing cards" and swap to the Cloud version of the docs.
fields.summary: Clicking on "Learn more about card colours" in Board settings does not take me to a guide.

fields.description:
... it's easier to start sprints with minimum ticket moving.

Everything in backlog is in priority and estimated

Jira suggest that the top x tickets would be a sprint

Or if in kanban, suggest the velocity of the week or 2 week or something...

A smarter backlog por favor!
fields.summary: As an engineering manager, I want to see the sprint estimate the line of tickets for me so ...

fields.description:
I never understood why dashboards can only be populated with a non-interactive wallboard. 

As a PO/Scrum Master, I want my virtual dashboard to be as rich and interactive as a physical board.
fields.summary: Make an interactive board gadget for dashboards

fields.description:
Hi,

I'm not a fan of the New View for JIRA Software Issues, but I have to use it occasionally while troubleshooting user support issues (found one bug with it today; will report it later). One thing that I absolutely despise while using it is the auto-rendering "feature" (giant quotes required) when using Wiki Markup or Markdown in a comment RTF field.

Please, please, please provide the following options when using a markup language in RTF fields:

1. DO add a text mode for use with markup languages.
2. DO allow text mode editing in a markup language when editing an existing comment.
3. DO NOT auto-render any text in text mode until the editing session ends.

I understand why some users like WYSIWYG fields, but plenty of users prefer to edit and compose in markup languages.

Thanks.
fields.summary: Provide Text Mode Option in Comment and Other RTF Fields

fields.description:
Currently, if you have a high-resolution screen (I.e:. 4k screen) with the setting to display more content into the view, the burndown chart splits the days in 12h timeframes.

This cause some confusions at the report and would be great if it keeps the timeframe by day instead of splitting into 12h.

Normal Resolution
 !image-2019-08-16-15-29-46-118.png|thumbnail! 

High Resolution same as zoom out the page

fields.summary: Keep Burndown Chart timeline in days when using high resolution screens on Google Chrome

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Fisheye Review tab is blank on the new issue view
h3. Environment
 * Jira Software Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Connect Jira and Fisheye via Application Link
 # Create a Review and link it to Jira using the Issue Key

h3. Expected Results

The Review is visible in the Review tab
h3. Actual Results

The Review tab is blank
h3. Workaround

Click the "*See the old view*" option above on the right side, to change the display to the old view. You can also *disable the Lab option* to use only the old issue view by doing the following:
 # Click on your Avatar on the Left Sidebar > Personal Settings
 # Scroll down to Jira Labs
 # Toggle the button off
fields.summary: Review tab is blank on the new issue view

fields.description: Another form of roadmap is a configurable n x m grid of cells, with each cell containing a list of tickets from a defined release/label.
fields.summary: Release/Label-based Roadmap

fields.description:
h3. Description

As I user, I would like to have the ability to manage when the issues will be archived in Next-Gen projects as 14-days could not be desirable.
fields.summary: As I user, I would like to have the ability to manage when the issues will be archived in Next-Gen projects

fields.description:
Ability to reorder sub-tasks using drag-drop function is great!! Love it.

However, it would be super useful if the sub-tasks automatically sorted by Priority
fields.summary: Default sort on sub-tasks by Priority in Issue Detail View

fields.description:
*Current Behavior:*
 * Move Sprint Down and Move Sprint Up options 
 * Tedious to reorganize future sprint buckets

*Suggested Behavior:*
 * Add a drag handle on Sprint Header similar to that in issue Details view allowing reordering of sub-tasks  **
fields.summary: Ability to drag drop Sprint buckets on the Backlog View
Ability to Print Cards for future sprint on backlog
